str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
To look at, regard attentively, take heed, beware, consider. From skopos; to take aim at, i.e. regard.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Division, dissension, standing apart. From a derivative of dis and stasis; disunion, i.e. dissension.
A snare, stumbling-block, cause for error. Scandal; probably from a derivative of kampto; a trap-stick, i.e. Snare.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From ek and klino; to deviate, i.e. to shun, or to decline.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
